funcs.name: override_function
funcs.desc: Overrides built-in functions by replacing them in the symbol table.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.

args.name: args
args.desc:
The function arguments, as a comma separated string.

Usually you will want to pass this parameter, as well as the function_code parameter, as a single quote delimited string. The reason for using single quoted strings, is to protect the variable names from parsing, otherwise, if you use double quotes there will be a need to escape the variable names, e.g. \$your_var.

args.name: code
args.desc: The new code for the function.

funcs.name: rename_function
funcs.desc: Renames a orig_name to new_name in the global function table. Useful for temporarily overriding built-in functions.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.

args.name: new_name
args.desc: The new name for the original_name function.

funcs.name: apd_set_pprof_trace
funcs.desc: Starts debugging to pprof_{process_id} in the dump directory.

return.desc: Returns path of the destination file.

args.name: dumpdir
args.desc: The directory in which the profile dump file is written. If not set, the apd.dumpdir setting from the php.ini file is used.

funcs.name: apd_set_session_trace_socket
funcs.desc: Connects to the specified tcp_server (eg. tcplisten) and sends debugging data to the socket.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.

args.name: ip_or_filename
args.desc: IP or Unix Domain socket (like a file) of the TCP server.

args.name: domain
args.desc: Can be AF_UNIX for file based sockets or APD_AF_INET for standard tcp/ip.

args.name: port
args.desc: You can use any port, but higher numbers are better as most of the lower numbers may be used by other system services.

args.name: mask
args.desc:
An integer which is formed by adding together the XXX_TRACE constants.

It is not recommended to use MEMORY_TRACE. It is very slow and does not appear to be accurate. ASSIGNMENT_TRACE is not implemented yet.

To turn on all functional traces (TIMING, FUNCTIONS, ARGS SUMMARY (like strace -c)) use the value 99

funcs.name: apd_breakpoint
funcs.desc: This can be used to stop the running of your script, and await responses on the connected socket. To step the program, just send enter (a blank line), or enter a php command to be executed.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.

funcs.name: apd_continue
funcs.desc: Usually sent via the socket to restart the interpreter.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.

funcs.name: apd_echo
funcs.desc: Usually sent via the socket to request information about the running script.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.
